item.title: Russia sentences American woman to 12 years for donation aiding Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The woman, Ksenia Karelina, a beautician living in Los Angeles, was visiting family in Russia when she was arrested at the airport over a donation of about $50 to an aid group.

item.title: Ukraine says it has taken 100 more Russian soldiers in Kursk offensive
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: Ukraine says Russia has been in contact about a new prisoner exchange amid reports that hundreds of Russian servicemen have been seized in the Kursk operation.

item.title: Israel is redrawing the West Bank, cutting into a prospective Palestinian state
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Claire Parker, Sufian Taha , Lorenzo Tugnoli
item.description: Israeli land grabs, settlement expansion and demolitions in Palestinian communities mark the most significant territorial changes in the West Bank in decades.

item.title: More than 40,000 killed in Israel’s war in Gaza, Health Ministry says
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger
item.description: The Gaza Health Ministry does not distinguish between civilians and combatants but aid workers and experts say the 40,000 figure is probably an undercount.

item.title: Gaza cease-fire talks to resume in Qatar without Hamas in attendance
item.dc:creator: Louisa Loveluck, Adela Suliman, Frances Vinall
item.description: Israel and the United States, with mediating partners Egypt and Qatar, will resume high-stake negotiations in Doha over a cease-fire and hostage release deal.

item.title: What to know about Olympic boxer Imane Khelif’s cyberbullying complaint
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Victoria Bisset
item.description: French investigators are looking into charges including gender-based cyber harassment and public insult after the gold medalist was targeted in online attacks.

item.title: India pressed U.S. to go easy on Bangladeshi leader before her ouster, officials say
item.dc:creator: Gerry Shih, Ellen Nakashima, John Hudson
item.description: After Indian lobbying, Washington toned down its criticism of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. Now both countries must confront whether they mishandled Bangladesh.

item.title: Britain hands out prison terms for far-right riots in swift crackdown
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: More than 1,000 people have been arrested and roughly half of that number charged, police said.

item.title: Biden’s Gaza cease-fire plan teeters on brink ahead of high-stakes talks
item.dc:creator: John Hudson, Shira Rubin, Karen DeYoung, Susannah George
item.description: Looming over the negotiations are threats by Iran and Hezbollah to strike back against Israel after the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran.

item.title: Ukraine unleashes attacks on Russian airfields amid Kursk offensive
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, David Stern
item.description: After rushing reinforcements to Kursk and announcing a “counterterrorism” operation, Russian forces have failed to halt the nine-day incursion.

item.title: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida to step down next month
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee, Julia Mio Inuma
item.description: Kishida said he will stand down as leader of the Liberal Democratic Party, and therefore as prime minister, to allow the party to recover from recent scandals.

item.title: A charity gave donated candy to families. It turned out to be meth.
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall
item.description: New Zealand police are investigating the source of the candies, which were packed in Rinda-branded wrapping and had a potentially lethal concentration of meth.

item.title: As Vietnam tightens leash on criticism, scores are jailed and exiled
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan
item.description: The crackdown on human rights comes at a time when the United States is deepening security and economic ties with Hanoi.

item.title: Ukraine turns the tables on Russia
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: A bold Ukrainian operation in Kursk has humiliated Russian President Vladimir Putin and upended some of the logic of the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.

item.title: U.N. experts say Venezuela election results lack basic transparency
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt
item.description: A panel of four U.N. experts criticized Venezuela’s decision to announce an election outcome without offering a detailed breakdown of the vote.

item.title: U.S. plans to sell $20 billion in weapons to Israel over several years
item.dc:creator: Kyle Melnick, Karen DeYoung
item.description: The Biden administration approved a deal to sell F-15s, air-to-air missiles and munitions, but much of it won’t arrive in Israel until 2026 at the earliest.

item.title: Suspected Iranian hacks are latest round of U.S. election interference
item.dc:creator: Shane Harris, Ellen Nakashima, Josh Dawsey
item.description: National security officials and researchers noted a rise in “troublesome” Iranian influence operations designed to meddle in the U.S. presidential race.

item.title: Defense secretary’s intervention in 9/11 cases faces judge’s scrutiny
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: A judge overseeing the 9/11 cases against Khalid Sheikh Mohammed and others will examine if it was legal for Lloyd Austin to rescind their plea agreements.

item.title: Ukraine says captured Russian soldiers could be part of prisoner exchange
item.dc:creator: David Stern, Robyn Dixon
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky and his top military commander claimed more gains in advance in Kursk.

item.title: Disease was spreading in Gaza. Now there’s polio in the sewage.
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb
item.description: Israel’s war in Gaza has destroyed its water and sanitation infrastructure, leaving sewage in the streets as a breeding ground for infectious diseases.

item.title: In Australia, Raygun’s zero in Olympic breaking is a perfect score
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Frances Vinall
item.description: Rachael Gunn, aka Raygun, drew mockery for dance moves like the kangaroo paw. But that didn’t stop Aussies from cheering their Napoleon Vegemite for “having a go.”
